mil3.6.10:0.3: Question on Remembrance of What was Done Long Ago
mil3.6.10:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, how does one remember what was done long ago in the past?”
mil3.6.10:1.4: “Is it not, venerable Nāgasena, that one remembers with one’s mind and not with mindfulness?”
mil3.6.10:1.5: “Do you not know personally, your majesty, about some task you have done and have forgotten?”
mil3.6.10:1.7: “Then were you, your majesty, on that occasion without a mind?”
mil3.6.10:1.8: “Certainly not, venerable sir, on that occasion there was no mindfulness.”
mil3.6.10:1.9: “So, why do you say, your majesty, that
mil3.6.10:1.10: one remembers with one’s mind and not with mindfulness?”
mil3.6.10:3.1: Question on Remembrance of What was Done Long Ago tenth
